Description: Fragment from lower part of shallow open pottery vessel, cup or phiale? Very streaky black-brown glaze on the outside, more uniform black-brown glaze on the inside, with petals (?) painted in streaky, matt, added white and pale pink. Clay a pinkish light brown, 5YR7/6 -6/6, quite dense and hard, some small lime inclusions, no mica obvious.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 239, no. 256)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.216)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5969 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
